com.lonepulse.robozombie.request
Class AbstractSerializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>

java.lang.Object
  com.lonepulse.robozombie.request.AbstractSerializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
Type Parameters:
INPUT - the type to be serialized by this implementation

OUTPUT - the type which is taken up by the serialized content

All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlainSerializer
public abstract class AbstractSerializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
extends Object
implements Serializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>

An abstract implementation of Serializer which directs serialization for all Serializers. To create a custom Serializer extend this class and override serialize(InvocationContext, Object).

Note that all implementations should produce an output type which can be translated to an HttpEntity type specified on Entities.resolve(Class).

Note that all implementations are expected to be stateless. If a state is incurred, proper ThreadLocal management should be performed.



Since:
1.3.0

Version:
1.1.0

Author:
Lahiru Sahan Jayasinghe

Method Detail

run

public final OUTPUT run(InvocationContext context,
                        INPUT input)

Serializes the given model by performing the following steps.

  1. Verifies the type compatibility of the annotated model
  2. Initiates serialization as specified by the implementation


Specified by:
run in interface Serializer<INPUT,OUTPUT>
Parameters:
context - the InvocationContext which can be used to discover information about the current proxy invocation

input - the model to be converted to a serialized representation which captures all its information

Returns:
the serialized content which captures all the information the provided model

serialize

protected abstract OUTPUT serialize(InvocationContext context,
                                    INPUT input)

Takes a model which conforms to the input type of the Serializer and converts it to a content type suitable for network transmission.

Note that all outputs are translated to a corresponding HttpEntity for enclosure within an HttpRequest. Therefore, all output instances should comply to a type specified at Entities.resolve(Class).

Note that any runtime errors which might occur during serialization are caught, wrapped in an instance of SerializerException (stack-trace preserved) and allowed to bubble up.

Parameters:
context - the InvocationContext which supplies information on the proxy invocation

input - the input model to be serialized to a transmittable format

Returns:
the serialized output which will be translated to an HttpEntity

Since:
1.3.0
